sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using block matrices
message_1:
Suppose there are three linear equations with three unknowns represented by the following block matrix equation:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 0 & 6 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 8 \\ 18 \\ 30 \end{bmatrix}$$

Find the solution for the unknown vector $\begin{bmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{bmatrix}$ using block matrix methods.
message_2:
To solve the given block matrix equation, we first need to find the inverse of the matrix A:

$$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 0 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$$

We can find the inverse of A using the formula:

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\text{det}(A)} \text{adj}(A)$$

where det(A) is the determinant of A and adj(A) is the adjugate of A.

First, let's find the determinant of A:

$$\text{det}(A) = 2(3 \cdot 6 - 4 \cdot 0) - 1(0 \cdot 6 - 4 \cdot 5) + 0(0 \cdot 0 - 3 \cdot 5) = 2(18) - 1(-20) = 36 + 20 = 56$$

Now, let's find the adjugate of A:

$$\text{adj}(A) = \begin{bmatrix} (3 \cdot 6 - 4 \cdot 0) & -(0 \cdot 6 - 4 \cdot 5) & (0 \cdot 0 - 3 \cdot 5) \\ -(0 \cdot 6 - 4 \cdot 5) & (2 \cdot 6 - 0 \cdot 5) & -(2 \cdot 4 - 1 \cdot 0) \\ (0 \cdot 0 - 3 \cdot 5) & -(2 \cdot 4 - 1 \cdot 0) & (2 \cdot 3 - 1 \cdot 0) \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 18 & 20 & -15 \\ -20 & 12 & -8 \\ -15 & 8 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$$

Now, we can find the inverse of A:

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{56} \begin{bmatrix} 18 & 20 & -15 \\ -20 & 12 & -8 \\ -15 & 8 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$$

Finally, we can find the solution for the unknown vector by multiplying the inverse of A with the given vector B:

$$\begin{bmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{bmatrix} = A^{-1}B = \frac{1}{56} \begin{bmatrix} 18 & 20 & -15 \\ -20 & 12 & -8 \\ -15 & 8 & 6 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 8 \\ 18 \\ 30 \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{56} \begin{bmatrix} 18 \cdot 8 + 20 \cdot 18 - 15 \cdot 30 \\ -20 \cdot 8 + 12 \cdot 18 - 8 \cdot 30 \\ -15 \cdot 8 + 8 \cdot 18 + 6 \cdot 30 \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{56} \begin{bmatrix} 144 \\ 56 \\ 168 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 2.57 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$$

Therefore, the solution for the unknown vector is:

$$\begin{bmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 2.57 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$$
